>look I know this has been beaten to death, but I was wondering does
>anyone have a copy of gladiators:BF.  I figured I would post even if
>I didn't own the registered game.  I know this game is awesome and I
>like it alot, but I am hesitant at paying 10 dollars(as small as the
>amount may seem) for anything whose development is halted.  Please do
>not respond and assume this is some kind of a plea for a password,
>this is just my opinoun.

Hiya! (Figured I'd send this to the list as well)

The lack of having G:BF out there is definitely my fault -- people have 
been asking for it for many months, but between hard drive crashes, my 
day-job, and lots of other little things, I haven't had a chance to get it 
re-posted recently :(

I do have an out-of-date version here on my hard drive -- it doesn't have 
the fixes/features of the more recent versions, but I suppose it's better 
than nothing.  The file is about 18 megs in size, I think -- here, I'll put 
a link to it at:
         http://24.2.87.94/GladAlpha.zip

However, at the moment we're still not actively working on either version 
of the game (the 3.x series, or G:BF) -- that's because (as the active 
people on this list are probably tired of hearing me say), most of the team 
members from FSGames are split up and working at other game companies now 
.. Mike and Doug, for example, are on the D2 team at Blizzard, currently 
working on the D2 expansion set, etc... and I work with Sluggy Freelance 
(http://sluggy.com) all day, so we don't have much time to work on 
non-paying projects at the moment :(

--Tom
